en: Iran is experiencing another internet outage amid reports of over 12,000 deaths and numerous injuries, with the regime using the blackout to hide violence and calling for international intervention.
Following four days of internet blackout in Iran, reports show more than 12,000 casualties and many wounded, as the government and IRGC suppress information and seek urgent global response.
An internet shutdown in Iran coincides with reports of over 12,000 dead and many injured, while authorities use the outage to cover up violence and press for immediate international action.
